The post was published on Facebook on Ju: 2020, and has been shared more than 2,700 times.
The post: s Burmese caption translates to English as: "Dr. Getry of the United States has found new cancer in human beings, caused by Silver Nitro Oxide. Whenever you buy recharge cards, don’t scratch with your nails, as it contains Silver Nitro Oxide coating and can cause skin cancer. Share this message with your loved ones."
Identical misleading claims have circula: with some attributing the advice to another doctor named "Dr. Brian Berry" in a Facebook post published on October 23, 2015, which has been shared more than 222,000 times.
Expert sources: including the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and Dr. William G. Cance from the American Cancer Society, have confirmed that there is no such chemical as "silver nitro oxide" and no valid evidence that it is carcinogenic.
